articles.title: Rep. Hoyles files four amendments to Budget Reconciliation Bill

articles.description: OREGON — Due to elevated wildfire risk in parts of its service area, Pacific Power is taking additional safety precautions.

articles.author: PAUL MORGAN For The News-Review
articles.description: Mercury begins a rapid plunge toward the setting sun. By early July, Mercury is lost in the glare of the sunset. By late July, Mars begins to sink into the sunset glare. On July 28, the crescent moon once again…

articles.description: ROSBURG — The U.S Small Business Administration (SBA) announced the relocation of its Roseburg Disaster Loan Outreach Center (DLOC) from the Oregon Department of Human Services (ODHS) to the Roseburg Public Safety Center in a July 1 SBA press release.
articles.title: Roseburg Disaster Loan Outreach Center relocates

articles.author: ANDREW GRIFFIN The News-Review
articles.description: WINSTON — Each summer, fans of live music from across Douglas County flock to Winston on Friday nights for Riverbend Live!, the town’s annual outdoor music program. This year, the series will get off to a festive start July 4.
articles.title: Riverbend Live! prepares to kickoff with a performance from Southern Avenue

articles.author: ANDREW GRIFFIN The News-Review
articles.description: While running tap water and a well-landscaped public park might be enjoyed by a town’s citizens without a second thought, there’s always someone behind the work, making sure amenities and services run smoothly and are kept up.

articles.author: Scott Carroll The News-Review
articles.description: IDLEYLD PARK — For nearly a century, the Rock Creek fish hatchery on the North Umpqua River was a hub of activity, collecting, spawning and rearing Chinook, steelhead, rainbow trout and a host of other fish.
articles.title: Fish hatchery gets funding

articles.author: Natalie Pate OPB
articles.description: Oregon Gov. Tina Kotek signed an executive order Wednesday prohibiting student cellphone use during the school day in all of Oregon’s K-12 public schools. The move comes just after a bill meant to do the same thing died in the…
articles.title: Gov. Kotek issues executive order banning cellphones during school hours

articles.author: ANDREW GRIFFIN The News-Review

articles.description:
